subject: Automobile Racing
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Dario Franchitti will leave Nascar and return to IndyCar in 2009 as the replacement driver for Dan Wheldon at Chip Ganassi Racing. The move was announced by Ganassi, who also signed a multiyear sponsorship extension with Target for his open-wheel and Nascar programs. Franchitti won the 2007 IndyCar Series title and the Indianapolis 500 but left open-wheel for Nascar at the end of the season to drive Ganassi’s No. 40 Dodge in the Sprint Cup Series. Ganassi never secured sponsorship for that team and was forced to shutter it in July. At the time, Franchitti said that returning to IndyCar was not an option.
